page.title: 02Recreation in Escrick.
page.content: There is a fairly wide range of activities in Escrick,from the playgroup for the pre-school child to the Darby and Joan Club for the senior citizens.Included are the Young Farmers' Club,Girl Guides,the Women's Institute,the Village Hall Committee,the Working Men's Club and committees which raise money for various charities and causes,such as the NSPCC,St. Leonard's Hospice,Martin House Hospice for Children and projects in the Third World.Other pastimes enjoyed range from flower arranging to traction engine driving. News of local events can be put in the monthly parish magazine.Such an event in June 1985 was a family barn dance held at a local farm and organised by the Ladies' Fellowship.Funds are also currently being raised for the Darby and Joan outing to the Dales.
